content.text:
## Discord Plugin Bootstrap Fixes

Odilitime created a branch (odi-17) with fixes for bootstrap's actions/providers to address issues users were experiencing with version 1.7.0. The main problem involved serverId vs messageServerId migration causing "No server ID found" errors when running Discord bots. A fix was submitted via PR #6333, though it still required testing with discord plugin version 1.3.3. The team discussed rushing out a release with this critical fix.

Users experiencing issues with Discord bots were advised to either wait for the fix or try using an older core version like 1.6.5. The errors were primarily related to the bootstrap plugin's handling of server IDs and user permissions.

## Contract Address (CA) Visibility Discussion

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses on X/Twitter accounts. The team acknowledged this issue and committed to improving CA visibility. Shaw confirmed they would "get on it" regarding posting the CA across official accounts.

There was debate about whether to include the CA in Twitter bios or pinned tweets. The consensus was that pinned tweets would be more appropriate than bio placement (which could appear scam-like), and that the linktree would be refreshed to point to CoinGecko for token information. The team emphasized that finding the correct CA should take no more than 10 seconds on the website or Twitter.

## ElizaOS Cloud API Integration Issues

A developer reported getting "Model not found" errors when building ElizaOS cloud agents into their website using agent IDs and API endpoints. The solution provided was to use proper model parameter formatting with provider prefixes:
- openai/gpt-4o-mini
- anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5
- google/gemini-2.5-flash

This formatting is recommended when calling agent API endpoints from external websites.

## Core Development Updates

### Cursor AI Insights
Odilitime shared an important finding from a Cursor call: when users input their own Claude API key into Cursor, they don't get the Cursor-optimized version of Claude (where Cursor applies tricks to improve output).

### Unified Messaging API
Stan submitted PRs for both Telegram and Discord plugins implementing a unified messaging API with elizaOS support. The updates involved refactoring to use handleMessage instead of the deprecated sendMessage method.

### Hybrid Architecture RFC
Stan prepared an RFC document exploring persistent workers and hybrid architecture for ElizaOS. The team discussed the need for individual gateways for problematic connectors, with Shaw's preferred implementation visible in the Jeju cloud branch's discord-gateway.

Key architectural considerations included:
- Simple event pumps as the direction forward
- Multiple daemon instances per service for scale
- Higher priority/bandwidth event pumps for voice connections vs text
- Preprocessing to improve efficiency

### Cloud Optimizations
Stan is working on cloud fixes to handle TOCTOU (Time-of-check to time-of-use) race conditions using a deduct-before, reconcile-after approach, along with runtime initialization optimizations.

categories.title: Recent Bug Fixes in ElizaOS Plugins

content.text:
Two pull requests have been submitted to fix issues in the ElizaOS plugin system:

**PR #6333** by odilitime addresses a breaking change in the plugin-bootstrap and SQL plugins. This fix updates actions and providers to handle the renaming from `serverId` to `messageServerId`, ensuring compatibility across the affected plugins.

**PR #6339** by standujar resolves an issue in the plugin-sql package by skipping the pgcrypto extension when using PGLite. This prevents errors that occur when attempting to enable extensions not supported by the PGLite database implementation.

During the two-day period from January 7-8, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed moderate development activity. The project received 2 new pull requests, with 1 successfully merged into the codebase. Additionally, 7 new issues were opened, indicating ongoing bug reports, feature requests, or discussions from the community. The repository had 7 active contributors participating in development during this timeframe.

content.text: Issue #6310 proposes a user interface enhancement for the chat box component. The suggestion is to reduce the default size of the chat box to display only one line initially, with dynamic size adjustment that expands as users type more text across multiple lines. This improvement was contributed by borisudovicic and aims to optimize the chat interface's screen space usage while maintaining usability.

## Overview

On January 7, 2026, ElizaOS achieved significant progress in plugin stability, UI/UX improvements, and agent management. Critical bug fixes were implemented for `plugin-bootstrap` and `plugin-sql` related to server ID changes, while efforts continued to resolve a publishing failure for `plugin-discord`. The team also focused on optimizing runtime performance and database query patterns.
